awd_titl_txt: Stretching of the Central Pacific Lithosphere:  En-echelon  Ridges and Crossgrain Lineations on the Superwell
awd_abstract_narration: Several types of geophysical observations indicate that the                     lithosphere in the southcentral Pacific is undergoing diffuse                   north-south extension.  As a partial test of this hypothesis, the               Principle Investigator will survey a previously uncharted series of             en-echelon ridges that extend for 2500 km from the East Pacific                 Rise to the northern edge of the Tuamotu archipelago.  A major                  implication of the stretching hypothesis is that some volcanic                  activity in the west Pacific may be related to tensional failure of             the lithosphere rather than numerous mantle plumes.  The goals of               the survey are to first establish that the ridges exist where they              have not been charted, and that they are continuous.  The ridges                will also be dredged for petrologic and age studies, and the                    magnetic signature of the ridges will be determined.
